docs.lead_paragraph: The inspector general for the Department of Health and Human Services said that the insurance exchanges under the health care law did not have adequate safeguards.

headline.main: Eligibility for Health Insurance Was Not Properly Checked, Audit Finds
headline.print_headline: Eligibility for Health Insurance Was Not Properly Checked, Audit Finds

docs.abstract: Inspector general for Health and Human Services Dept reports that independent audit of insurance exchanges established under the health care law has found that federal and state officials did not properly check the eligibility of people seeking coverage and applying for subsidies; it is latest indication of unresolved problems at HealthCare.gov.
docs.snippet: The inspector general for the Department of Health and Human Services said that the insurance exchanges under the health care law did not have adequate safeguards.

docs.lead_paragraph: With immigration legislation dead for the year, Congress has a very short must-do list as relations between the two parties, already miserable, seem to be getting worse.

headline.main: Deadlock in Congress Appears to Worsen as Midterms Loom
headline.print_headline: As Midterms Near, Even Minimal Hopes for Action Sink

docs.abstract: Congressional Memo; Congress has a very short must-do list as relations between the two parties, already miserable, seem to be worsening in buildup to midterm elections; minimal expectations for achievement in final months of 113th Congress--and midpoint of Pres Obama’s second term--are sinking lower, if that is possible.
docs.snippet: With immigration legislation dead for the year, Congress has a very short must-do list as relations between the two parties, already miserable, seem to be getting worse.

docs.lead_paragraph: The court decided the case. But it did not settle the controversy.

headline.main: Hobby Lobby Is Only the Beginning
headline.print_headline: Hobby Lobby Is Only the Beginning

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Paul Horwitz submits that while Supreme Court has issued decision in Burwell vs Hobby Lobby Stores case, it has not decided larger dispute over Affordable Care Act's contraceptive mandate, which will rage for some time to come; holds that true sources of controversy lie outside of contraceptive mandate, touching on issues of religious accommodation, gay rights and the role of the marketplace in cultural conflicts.
docs.snippet: The court decided the case. But it did not settle the controversy.

docs.lead_paragraph: New tax rules will allow workers to spend a lump sum of their retirement savings in exchange for a guaranteed income in their later years.

headline.main: Longevity Insurance Joins the Menu of Retirement Plan Options
headline.print_headline: New Rules Let Longevity Insurance Join a Menu of Retirement Plan Options

docs.abstract: Treasury Department announces new rules that will allow workers to buy type of annuity known as longevity insurance inside their retirement plans; annuity aims to protect people from exhausting their savings in later years.
docs.snippet: New tax rules will allow workers to spend a lump sum of their retirement savings in exchange for a guaranteed income in their later years.

docs.lead_paragraph: The government is expanding its "mystery disease" program, funding a network at six universities around the country to help diagnose patients with diseases so rare they've been told they're undiagnosable.

docs.lead_paragraph: Their Senate majority in peril, anxious Democrats have seized the Supreme Court decision that some companies need not provide birth control to women as fresh evidence of the GOP's "war on women" — an argument they hope will energize female voters who could decide the balance of power on Capitol Hill.
